message_1: Alice encrypted a message using Caesar cipher, and the ciphertext is "JGNNQ." Bob knows that the message is in English, and he also knows that Alice used Caesar cipher. What is the plaintext message?
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we need to shift the letters back by the same amount Alice used when encrypting. Since we don't know the shift value, we can try all possible shifts (from 1 to 25) and see which one gives us a meaningful English word.

1. IFMMP
2. HELLO
3. GDKKN
4. FCJJM
5. EBIIL
6. DAHHK
7. CZGGJ
8. BYFFI
9. AXEEH
10. ZWDDG
11. YVCCF
12. XUBBE
13. WTAAD
14. VSZZC
15. URYYB
16. TQXXA
17. SPWWZ
18. ROVVY
19. QNUUX
20. PMTTW
21. OLSSV
22. NKRRU
23. MJQQT
24. LIPPS
25. KHOOR

The only meaningful English word in this list is "HELLO" (shift of 2). So, the plaintext message is "HELLO."
